file_content.text: You delivered the exact results I hoped for. Quell is like an imbibed torture device, infesting those rebel slaves.
It's exhilarating to see the effects on the survivors, who can only stand by and watch helplessly.
Domination of the weak is always an exhilarating experience.
I understand how you feel.
Truer words have seldom been spoken.
You were right. Quell toxin is a powerful and useful tool.
Then it worked.
One might even say it's revolutionary.
I trust you'll share your research findings with Imperial Intelligence?
Others can learn from you.
Naturally. Anything for my fellow servants of the Emperor.
You paid for suffering, and I delivered.
I get results.
Quite so. I'll recommend your services highly to my fellow Sith.
How wonderful.
I'm ready for a reward.
I promised you'd be compensated well, and I stand by my promises.
Quell toxin will be a great asset to the Empire. Uprisings will end painfully and decisively.
You've earned your reward, my friend. Now go--I have horror and despair to observe and chronicle.
I don't understand why it didn't work. I was meticulous with my measurements.
Those slaves must be more fragile than I thought. The Quell you put in their water supply is killing them outright.
The shock of instant death will throw the slaves off-balance.
Perhaps that's best.
Shock? I'm not interested in such brute force.
You can't have a slave rebellion with no slaves, right?
It's not all bad.
True, but I still feel I've missed a golden opportunity.
Espionage is complicated. Things rarely go as planned.
These things happen.
True, true--but I had such hopes for this experiment.
Those slaves didn't look all that healthy to me.
Life in the jungle is hard.
Fair point. Perhaps this revolt was on its last legs before I arrived.
That's unfortunate.
It's simply infuriating. All that careful planning for nothing.
Well don't look at me.
No need to get defensive. I'm not accusing you of anything.
All my research is now useless. Ah, well. You did as I asked, and your payment was not contingent on the results.
Here, take your credits and go. I have a great deal of thinking to do.
I can't begin my research until you contaminate the slaves' water supply with Quell toxin. Get to work.
Sergeant Slarin will give you the Quell toxin. Use it to taint the slaves' water supply.
Exactly as reported. A degree-six revolt, population equivalent to the Duros uprising on Zilior. Subjects occupy a moderate radius of jungle. Good, good....
Welcome, apprentice. Your timing couldn't be better. I am Lord Drowl.
I recognize you from my dealings with Imperial Intelligence. I am Lord Drowl.
What have we here, a hunter? I have need of you. I am Lord Drowl.
And who is this, observing my work? Permit me to introduce myself. I am Lord Drowl.
When the Empire encounters resistance on its conquered worlds, they call me. I'm here to end the slave uprising on Dromund Kaas.
Welcome to the Imperial capital, my lord.
I'm honored.
Just the right tone of obedience. You'll be an excellent asset here.
I wasn't aware there was a slave revolt going on.
Uprising?
Very soon, there won't be. You can assist me in ending it.
You enjoy your job, don't you?
Looks like fun.
Dominating lesser beings and squashing their will to resist? Of course I enjoy it. I think you will, too.
The situation is this: A Sith Lord was constructing a colossal statue of himself in the jungle. His slaves revolted and armed themselves.
The colossus remains unfinished and well-armed slaves now control the jungle. An embarrassment for the Empire, but an opportunity for me.
What can these renegade slaves possibly provide you?
An opportunity?
Test subjects, of course. A means of perfecting my techniques.
Yes, yes--to do what?
Excited? Good. This is a chance to refine the Empire's methods of suppressing rebellion.
Sounds like the perfect opportunity to thin the slave population.
To kill slaves, you mean.
Slave deaths will be a byproduct of my plan, but not the focus.
I'm testing a toxic weapon--a poison called Quell. Its victims experience a prolonged state of agonizing pain before finally dying.
The victims' allies are so horrified by Quell's effects, they lose their wills to resist. At least, that's what I intend to prove.
What a disturbing experiment. You're quite the sadist, Lord Drowl.
You're good at this.
Please, there's no need for flattery.
What important research.
Yes, cowing the masses is a complex art. It requires a great deal of fine tuning.
Disgusting!
That's one of the things I love best about it.
I need someone to introduce a controlled amount of Quell into the slaves' water supply so that I can determine the proper dosage.
The work is dangerous--there will be armed slaves everywhere--but your success will be well rewarded. What do you say?
I prefer to deal death more directly to my opponents.
I'll help, but not gladly.
My methods extend well beyond a lightsaber's reach, my friend. Expand your horizons.
I'll always aid in the advancement of the killing sciences.
It will be a pleasure.
I suspected as much.
I'm at home dealing death from the shadows.
Not a problem.
Indeed, the most effective agents of the Empire are the ones who work behind the scenes.
A job is a job. Just tell me what to do.
I'm ready to work.
A true professional. I respect that.
Ready when you are.
Maybe later.
This is an important opportunity to advance our Empire's ability to control its interests. Reconsider.
I'm honored to be a part of your efforts, my lord.
You're right, I'm in.
I suppose it's worth my time.
Superb. Then let's get started.
Invade the slave camps scattered throughout the jungle. Inject the Quell toxin into the slaves' water filtration systems.
My assistant, Sergeant Slarin, will recommend the correct dosage of Quell and give you a supply. See him at the research tent.
No means no. [Refuse quest]
I'm not used to taking "no" for an answer, but I won't force you.
Return if you change your mind. I've only just begun this operation.
Go on about your business. My experiments demand complete concentration.
